name: DoxyGen Syntax
summary: DoxyGen Highlighting on top of c/c++/java
description:
This Script has been moved into Vim7.

:set syntax=cpp.doxygen

Provides DoxyGen Highlighting on top of c/c++/idl/java.[160][160]DoxyGen is close to JavaDoc that it should be fine for JavaDoc as well.[160][160]It supports most of the keywords in DoxyGen in one way or another.

There may be some problems where doxygen tags need to be included in exclusion groups of the c/c++/java/idl files.

At the moment, it uses non-conventional colours, which I think is good, as it differentiates it from the source-code.[160][160]Please let me know if your opinion differs, especially if you have a set of standard defaults that would be appropriate.
install_details:
Needs to be sourced after the language files.
 To detect *.doxygen files as being doxygen, make the file
 ---------8[60]----------- .vim\ftdetect\doxygen.vim -----------
[160][160]au BufNewFile,BufRead *.doxygen setfiletype doxygen
 ------------------------------------------------------------
 There are a few ways to add doxygen syntax hilighting to c,cpp,idl files,
 1: create files .vim/syntax/c.vim[160][160].vim/syntax/cpp.vim .vim/syntax/ which
 load the original syntax before loading doxygen.vim syntax hilighting.
[160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160][160] 
 2: Before :syntax on in your _vimrc, put
 let mysyntaxfile='[60]some_path[62]/doxygen_load.vim'
 and then create the following file.
 -----------8[60]--------- [60]some_path[62]/doxygen_load.vim --------
 au! Syntax {cpp,c,idl}
 au Syntax {cpp,c,idl} runtime syntax/doxygen.vim
 ------------------------------------------------------------

versions.release_notes:
1.  Words like `Class#Member' is highlighted together as a link in my
    version.
2.  I used `doxygenHyperLink' instead of `doxygenHttpLink' and
    highlighted http, https, and ftp protocols.
3.  I added the missing `doxygenSpecialArgumentWord' to make `\a' (not
    the word after) appear the same way as `\c'.
4.  I made some adjustments in font choosing on non-Windows platforms.
5.  The `Last Change' date is not updated in your file.
6.  There are some trailing spaces in your file.

Fixed up[160][160]\c words ending in )[160][160](Wu Yongwei)
 - With auto-brief //![60] followed by /** shouldn't supress the auto-brief in[160][160] the /**. (Reported by Markus Trenkwalder)
 - Allow numbers in @link linkwords (Reporeted by Wu Yongwei)
- Don't treat # preceded by a word-end as a Hash-special (Reported by Wu Yongwei)
- include # (@c #include) in the small-specials allowed chars. (Wu[160][160]Yongwei)
 - Highlight http[s] links (Wu Yongwei)
 - Various (Wu Yongwei)
- Fixed up ending of brief lines with respect to line @ commands and[160][160]end-comment. Not ending a brief no longer produces an error-comment.

[160][160] - Allow doxygen comments inside brackets (Suggested by Zygmunt Krynicki)
[160][160] - Restore correct font selection (Wu Yongwei)
[160][160] - Don't end brief when encountering ? or ! as this isn't what happens with doxygen.
[160][160] - Make punctuation an option.
[160][160] - Make short words end with a , eg \c word,[160][160](Wu Yongwei)
1.11
[160][160] - Thanks to Joseph Barker for pointing out that I had a syntax error in[160][160]1.10

Thanks to Toby Allsopp for this version:
 - Allow javadoc style auto-brief to be disabled
 - Move various definitions from single to multiline definitions 
Also added the .txt help file.
- Fix up some regions not marked as contained (code, verbatim, dot being highlighted outside of the doxygen region) (Toby Allsopp) - Only mark recognised HTML tags (Suggested by Mike Anderson)

[160][160]- Ignore Errors when loading from idl.
[160][160]- Try and match # and \c &c support to match what really happens. (Reported by Wu Yongwei)
[160][160]- Don't go into doxygen mode for /**/
[160][160]- Fix up syncing of brief after a \def or similar line - character
[160][160][160][160]immediately following a leading asterisk were being hilighted long.
[160][160]- Try and work out a better default font for \c
[160][160]- add support for \code \endcode \verbatim \endverbatim (no contained elements) (suggested Yongwei)
[160][160]- add contained support for dot (\dot \enddot)
[160][160]- support html [60]!-- --[62] comments.
[160][160]- support for params inside \c \ref brackets (can contain spaces?).
[160][160]- highlight closing */ as error when found inside \code, \verbatim sections as well as \c, \ref sections with
[160][160][160][160]unmatched brackets.

- Fix up # support.
 - Highlight \\endlink properly.
 - Don't mark */ as an error where there is no brief, or @{ is used.

- Make sure @c \c and friends are equivalent for the start of a brief section.- Allow @c \c and friends to cross lines. (Caveat, they can't be hard up[160][160]against a continuation '*' - it just gets tooo difficult).- Highlight a missing \endlink as an error.- Fix multiline description without a '*'

- Patches from Wu Yongwei
[160][160]* Include '-' in inline \c \e maching.
[160][160]* \see, \return are multiline desc.
[160][160]* \throw can now handle std::alloc (colons were confusing it)
- Fixed support for [60]a href=[62] links.
- Reported by Wu Yongwei
[160][160]* Handle [in,out] in \param.
[160][160]* Handle non-terminating . in a brief description (eg A.B)
[160][160]* allow leading asterix inside HTML marks.
[160][160]* Fix up [60]a[62] link hilighting when interupted by new-lines and comment
[160][160]continuations.
[160][160]* Handle the case where \c \ref etc are used at the beginning of a 'brief'
[160][160]line.
- Fixed termination of multiline at start of new command.
- Include John McGehee's instructions.
